page.title: 08THE VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: THE SCHOOL SERVES THE VILLAGE OF WEST BUTTERWICK,A FEW HOUSES AT OUTMILL AND FARMS WITHIN A 1 MILE RADIUS.CURRENTLY ALL THE CHILDREN ARE FROM THE VILLAGE.24 CHILDREN WERE BORN IN THE VILLAGE.THE SCHOOL WAS BUILT AS A 2 CLASSROOM CHURCH OF ENGLAND SCHOOL IN 1871 AND NUMBERS HAVE VARIED FROM 7 TO 150.THE PRESENT NUMBER OF 43 IS LOW.PREVIOUS HEADTEACHERS HAVE LIVED IN THE SCHOOL HOUSE IN THE VILLAGE.ALL 4 TEACHING STAFF TRAVEL IN BY CAR .THE 3 ANCILLARY STAFF LIVE IN THE VILLAGE.MOST HEADS STAYED FOR ONLY A SHORT TIME BUT THE PRESENT HEAD HAS BEEN HERE FOR 9 YEARS.THE CHILDREN LEAVE AT THE AGE OF 11,WHEN THEY GO TO SOUTH AXHOLME COMPREHENSIVE AT EPWORTH.EXTENSIONS HAVE BEEN ADDED OVER THE YEARS;STAFFROOM,KITCHEN,AND MOST RECENTLY INDOOR TOILETS.
